item.title: Twinkle Khanna Gets to Live Every Potterhead's Dream in Latest Outing, See Pic
item.description: Twinkle Khanna and kids have accompanied Akshay Kumar to the UK and she recently visited the iconic Elephant House in Edinburgh.

item.title: Mukesh and Nita Ambani Launch Book on Coronavirus Penned By 3 Indian Medical Experts
item.description: The book, written by three Indian medical experts, focuses on the history, evolution, facts and myths around the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Priyanka Chopra's Memoir 'Unfinished' is Complete and is 'Coming Soon'
item.description: 'Unfinished' is a collection of personal essays, stories and observations of Priyanka Chopra, to be published by Penguin Random House India.

item.title: Mom Laughed When I Said I Wanted to Be Writer: Ruskin Bond
item.description: Ruskin Bond's aim was to write stories and become an author, but no one else seemed to think it was a good idea.

item.title: 'Narcissist', 'Shameless Liar': Mary Trump's Book Gives an Insider View Into Making of US President
item.description: The book is about how Donald Trump became the man he is today. And, the answer, of course, Mary claims, lies in his dysfunctional family, and his loveless upbringing.

item.title: 'How's The Josh?': Here's How Manohar Parrikar Planned Surgical Strikes In Retaliation To Uri Attack
item.description: In the biography of the former defence minister and Goa's ex-CM Manohar Parrikar, authors' Sadguru Patil and Mayabhushan outline how the surgical strikes were planned in retaliation to the Uri attack in 2016.

item.title: Ranbir Kapoor Reads Book on Filmmaking in This Throwback Pic
item.description: The book in Ranbir Kapoor's hand is Robert Evans’ autobiography ‘The Kid Stays In the Picture’.

item.title: Sonam Kapoor's Throwback Pic is All About Her Love for Reading
item.description: Sonam Kapoor says she is bookworm as she posts a throwback picture on social media.

item.title: JK Rowling Explains Gender Identity Comments as She Comes Out as Sexual Assault Survivor
item.description: "That assault happened at a time and in a space where I was vulnerable, and a man capitalised on an opportunity," said JK Rowling recounting her encounter with domestic violence and sexual abuse in her 20s.

item.title: Here Are Six Books to Read During Pride Month
item.description: LGBTQ Pride Month celebrations in June include pride parades, parties, workshops, symposia and concerts, but since this year is all about social distancing, here are suggestions to mark the occasion with books.

item.title: From Sex Worker Mothers to Lesbian Parents: The Changing Face of Motherhood in India
item.description: Pooja Pande’s book ‘Momspeak: The Funny, Bittersweet Story of Motherhood in India’, outlines some very patriarchal practices that are accepted as norms in our society, even to this day.

item.title: Delhi Publisher is Home Delivering Books to Help Small Shops Survive the Pandemic
item.description: With social distancing becoming the new norm, small bookstores in Delhi may be in for a lurch, even if rules were relaxed.

item.description: On her 94th birth anniversary, here are some inspiring quotes by acclaimed author Harper Lee.

item.title: World Book Day 2020: 5 Texts You Should Read During Quarantine
item.description: Lockdown could possibly be the best time to get yourself a book and start reading. What better occasion than World Book Day 2020?

item.title: Actress-author Patricia Bosworth Dies from Coronavirus at 86
item.description: Patricia Bosworth's stepdaughter, Fia Hatsav, said that pneumonia brought on by the virus was the cause of death.

item.title: Tahira Kashyap to Launch New Book 'The 12 Commandments of Being a Woman'
item.description: On International Women's Day, author-filmmaker Tahira Kashyap Khurrana announced on Instagram that she will be writing her new book The 12 Commandments of Being A Woman.

item.title: Reviving the Indian Economy: Montek Singh Ahluwalia's Method of Combating 'Very Serious Slowdown'
item.description: During the launch of the book, Ahluwalia said that there is no doubt that we have entered a period of a very serious slowdown.

item.title: From Konyaks of Nagaland to Kurumbas of Nilgiris: A Look Into The Private lives of Isolated Indian Tribes
item.description: What makes things worse is that the government data and statistics fail to capture the essence of their everyday lives, and stories and narratives from the tribals themselves are conspicuously absent from mainstream literature.

item.title: Remembering Abraham Lincoln: 5 Books One Must Read About the Former US President
item.description: Lincoln, who was assassinated by John Wilkes Booth in 1865 while attending a play at Ford's Theatre, has been immortalized in the works of Gore Vidal, George Saunders, Herbert Donald to name a few.

item.title: Abhay Deol Proud of 'Baby Sis' Esha Deol Turning Author
item.description: Esha Deol's book Amma Mia! talks about the difficulties of motherhood and how a woman can overcome them.

item.title: Sridevi's Biographer Satyarth Nayak Says He Wanted to Know Many Things About the Bollywood Actress
item.description: Legendary actress late Sridevi's biographer Satyarth Nayak talked about many questioned that he had in mind to ask the actress but could not due to her untimely death in February 2018.

item.title: Why Jawaharlal Nehru Wanted India to Embrace 'Tolerant and Creative Nationalism'
item.description: Nehru said, whatever confusion the present may contain, in the future, India will be a land, as in the past, of many faiths equally honoured and respected, within a tolerant, creative nationalism, not a narrow nationalism living in its own shell.

item.title: Shashi Tharoor's New Book Explains India's Potential To Become A 'Major Global Power'
item.description: The authors argue that India has a major role to play in shaping the regimes the world in future, given its size, growing clout, and stake in practically every major multilateral organization.

item.title: Horror Writer Stephen King Quits Facebook Over Misinformation
item.description: Stephen King has quit Facebook, saying there is too much fake news and misinformation on the platform.

item.description: As we observe Rudyard Kipling's 84th death anniversary, here are five of his most remarkable works one must read.

item.title: Stephen King Criticized for Comments on Diversity
item.description: Stephen King's comments came shortly after the announcement of this year’s nominees for the Academy Awards, widely criticized for only choosing male directors and for an almost entirely white group of acting finalists.

item.title: Jeevan Samvad, Hindi Series on Depression and Suicide, Launched in Book Form
item.description: News18.com Hindi editor Dayashankar Mishra has written about mental health issues while combining both an Indian traditional viewpoint and the modern aspect.

item.title: TS Eliot Letters Show Love for Muse But Poet Downplays it
item.description: Emily Hale eventually developed feelings for TS Eliot, but the poet writes that, as time went on, he realised "more and more how little Emily Hale and I had in common".

item.title: Vichhoda Book Review: Harinder Sikka’s Exploration of Tender Love Beneath Tough Exteriors
item.description: Vichhoda moves through the bylanes of Kashmir and reaches corruption-ridden small towns of Pakistan to seek humanity in the most unexpected places.

item.title: Ashok Banker Retells Lord Ram's Tale Through Graphic Novel
item.description: The graphic novel is published by Campfire and has illustrations by award-winning artist Sachin Nagar. Author and screenwriter Banker's writing spans across genres of crime thrillers, essays, literary criticism and fiction

item.description: ‘I am your fate,’ he continued – and disappeared at once.

item.title: Happy Birthday Nicholas Sparks: 5 Films Based on His Novels
item.description: On the novelist’s 54th birthday, here is a look at some of his works that have made it to Hollywood films.

item.title: Renowned Hindi Author Ganga Prasad Vimal Dies in Road Accident in Sri Lanka
item.description: Ganga Prasad Vimal wrote more than one dozen poetry collections, short story collections and novels. His last novel, Manushkhor, was published in 2013. He received several Hindi literary awards.

item.title: Colours of the Mountain Author Da Chen Dies at 57
item.description: Chen died of lung cancer on December 17, his wife, Dr Sun-Ling Chen, told a publication on Tuesday from the family's home in Temecula, California.

item.title: 'Replicated His Tattoo...': How Anita Nair's Iconic 'Inspector Gowda' Became Face of Indian Crime Fiction
item.description: In the last decade, detective Borei Gowda has appeared in two of Nair's books -- Cut Like Wound (2012) and Chain of Custody (2016) and have already won a strong fan base among crime fiction lovers in the country.

item.title: Author JK Rowling Draws Criticism for Transgender Comments
item.description: JK Rowling tweeted in support of a researcher who lost her job for stating that people cannot change their biological sex. A spokeswoman for Rowling said that the author would not have any further comment.

item.title: Haruki Murakami Holds Rare Public Reading to Mark Debut Anniversary
item.description: Now 70 and one of the world’s most popular and acclaimed novelists, Murakami debuted with 'Hear the Wind Sing' in 1979.

item.title: Amitabha Bagchi’s Novel 'Half The Night Is Gone' Wins DSC Prize for South Asian Literature 2019
item.description: Amitabha Bagchi won the award from a shortlist of six South-Asian novels.

item.title: Remembering Luigi Pirandello: 5 Works by the Celebrated Italian Writer
item.description: Luigi Pirandello is considered to be one of the forerunners of the Theatre of the Absurd. On the writer's 93rd death anniversary, here's looking at 5 works by him one must read.

item.title: Amitabh Bachchan Pens Foreword for Roopkumar Rathod's Photo Book
item.description: Roopkumar, who is best known for his songs "Maula mere maula" and "tujh mein rab dikhta hai", launched his book on Saturday in Mumbai.

item.title: From Heart of Darkness to Lord Jim, Here are 5 Books by Joseph Conrad That One Must Read
item.description: Joseph Conrad passed away on August 3, 1924 and left behind a rich heritage in terms of works, which have often transcended the pages of books and have found new life in varied media.

item.title: 26/11 Terror Attacks: Martyred ATS Chief Hemant Karkare Was Brave in Life, as He Was in Death
item.description: One of the biggest issue that Karkare's death brought to light was that of 'faulty' bulletproof jackets, which allegedly could not protect him and resulted in his death on 26/11.

item.title: 26/11 Mumbai Attacks: 5 Books That Give Insight into the Brazen Events of 2008
item.description: On the occasion remembering those who lost their lives in the attack, here are 5 books that give a comprehensive insight into the brazen events that unfolded in 2008.

item.description: A new book on the life and times of legendary spymaster RN Kao, founding father of India's external intelligence agency Research & Analysis Wing (RAW), will hit the stands soon, announced publishing house Bloomsbury.

item.title: Can Robots Take Away Our Jobs? Here's How Indian Employment Market Will Change with AI-driven Revolution
item.description: The evolution of AI has brought us to the precipice of a fourth industrial revolution, and the worrying question being asked is: How will this affect our livelihoods? Will this revolution result in mass job losses?

item.title: Book Alert! Here's What You Can Expect From Christopher C. Doyle's 'The Pataala Prophecy' Sequel
item.description: The newest book of The Pataala Prophecy series claims to have a good mix of adventure, mythology and mystery as series' teenager protagonists, Maya and Arjun, return to have a face-off with a new ruthless enemy.

item.description: On HG Wells 153 birth anniversary, here's looking at a few works by the acclaimed author.

item.title: Shiv Sena's Anti-Bihari Rhetoric Has an Underlying Irony That Traces its Origin to Bal Thackeray’s Father
item.description: While his son Bal Thackeray and grandsons Uddhav and Raj were to take a political position against north Indians, Prabodhankar traced the roots of Chandraseniya Kayastha Prabhu caste -- the same caste to which the Thackeray family belongs -- to Bihar.

item.title: Michael Schumacher Admitted in Paris Hospital, to Undergo ‘Secret Stem Cell Treatment’: Report
item.description: According to Le Parisien, the 50-year-old Formula 1 legend is in the cardiovascular department overseen by surgeon Philippe Menasche, described as a 'pioneer in cell surgery against heart failure'.

item.title: When Amitav Ghosh Found Climate Change to be Stranger Than Fiction
item.description: Ghosh's novel leaps from the United States, to the Sundarbans mangrove forest between India and Bangladesh, to Italy, places where rising temperatures and water levels have uprooted human and animal lives and upended political systems.

item.description: Cow and Company uses satire to take stock of India and its complex relationship with religions.

item.description: The novel begins with the death of a scientist, who warns a woman politician in new Delhi about the impending danger to the life of Raghav Mohan, who is the beloved Prime Minister of the country.

item.title: Book Excerpt: When Rajnath Singh Refused To Give a Ticket to His Son for 2007 UP Polls
item.description: Rajneeti: A Biography of Rajnath Singh written by Gautam Chintamani chronicles the fifty-year long political journey of Singh from a Swayamsevak in the RSS to the defence minister of India.

item.description: Savarkar defined his idea of a Hindu resurgence in political terms, not religious.

item.description: Women Poet Saints of the Bhakti Movement broke free of the draconian Hindu code of life prescribed by Manu to find their religious and spiritual freedom.

item.description: This is the first and only detailed chronicle of the screen goddess' long journey in Bollywood.

item.description: German-born poet, novelist and painter Hermann Karl Hesse, who won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1946, passed away on August 9, 1962.

item.title: Book Excerpt: Dalit Scholar Suraj Yengde Tells You Why 'Caste Matters' In His Latest Novel
item.description: In this deeply passionate, and angry memoir, titled 'Caste Matters', writer and academic activist Suraj Yengde peels the layers of the deep-rooted caste system in India to show you how this impenetrable social divide has for centuries crushed human lives and is very similar to other forms of oppression, such as race, class and gender.

item.description: On Shirley Jackson's 54th death anniversary, here's looking at 5 most acclaimed works of the author.

item.description: To celebrate this incredible author’s 120th birth anniversary, we have compiled 10 famous Hemingway quotes that will leave you mesmerised.

item.description: As the world remembers the great leader on his 101 birth anniversary, here's taking at look at 5 books by Nelson Mandela.

item.description: Author author Easterine Kire's book gives a vivid account of Japanese invasion in India through the northeast during World War II.

item.description: Amitav Ghosh says he feels fortunate and privileged to be able to make a living from writing, which according to him, is the only thing he knows how to do.

item.description: Author Amish Tripathi launched Raavan: Enemy of Aryavarta, which is the third installment of his wildly popular Ram Chandra series.

item.description: Weaving old folklores with modern-day adventures, Ghosh again tries to draw readers attention towards climate change.

item.description: This re-telling of Mahabharata from the perspective of Shakuni delves into how the heir of Gandhara used the Padavas and the Kauravas as pawns in an intricate and clever power play that culminated in an epic battle of 18 days.

item.description: There's much to ponder over at the bookshelf this weekend.

item.title: George Orwell Birth Anniversary: 5 Books You Must Read by the Noted Author
item.description: Here's looking at five books by George Orwell that prove his relevance even today.

item.title: The Emergency of 1975: 5 Books on Trying Times in Indian History
item.description: Jawaharlal Nehru’s niece who was a fierce critic of the Emergency and of her cousin Mrs. Gandhi, is the author of the novel tells the story of two interlinked families in Delhi in the Emergency years.

item.description: On the 114th birth anniversary of Jean-Paul Sartre, we take a look at five books by and on the author-philosopher that one must read.

item.description: As the world remembers Che Guevara in his 91st birth anniversary, here is a look at 7 books one should read on the Argentine Marxist revolutionary.

item.title: Anne Frank’s 90th Birth Anniversary: Incomplete Work ‘Dear Kitty’ Published
item.description: At least 75 years after Anne Frank's death, a new version of her famed diary is being published, for now, only in German, titled Liebe Kitty (Dear Kitty)

item.title: The Price of Salt to Maurice, Books on Love You Need to Read This Pride Month
item.description: Here’s a look at tomes that have, over the years put forward stories of love, acceptance and battles fought by characters/individuals from the community for readers to mull over.

item.title: From Arundhati Roy to Amitav Ghosh: Books by Indian Authors to Add to Your Reading List in June
item.description: Many bookish treats for Indian bookworms await in June. Books written by authors such as Amitav Ghosh, Easterine Kire, and Arundhati Roy are definitely worth your TBR list. Here's more about June's book releases.

item.title: All You Need to Know About Blood, the Upcoming Memoir of Jonas Brothers
item.description: Blood will shine a light on Jonas Brothers' origins as a music group, their rise to stardom, the secrets behind their breakup and their recent return to the music scene.

item.title: Shouldn't Choose Permanent Side in Democracy: Chetan Bhagat Doles Out Political Advice in His Book 'India Positive'
item.description: India Positive is a collection of essays and columns through which the author discusses 'burning issues' of India like casteism, corruption, education, employment, politics, GST, and infrastructure.

item.title: Close to the Bone is Much More than a Cancer Memoir, Says Lisa Ray on her Debut Book
item.description: Lisa Ray says cancer has given her a new lease in life and she can no longer procrastinate pursuing her big dreams. Writing a book about her life experiences was one of them.

item.title: Book Excerpt: Meet the Rebel Mystic Poetess, Lal Ded, who Preached Religious Tolerance in 14th Century Kashmir
item.description: Lal Ded was a strong critic of idolatry and saw it as a useless and even silly ‘work’ which adjured the worshipper of stocks and stones to turn to yogic doctrines and exercise for salvation.

item.title: Remembering Jawaharlal Nehru: 5 Books You Must Read on India’s First Prime Minister
item.description: As India remembers one of its most iconic leader, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, we take a look at 5 books that one must read on him to have a better insight.

item.title: Book Excerpt: 'Countless Were killed, Many Raped,' Say Eyewitnesses of Bengal's Marichjhapi Massacre
item.description: The Marichjhapi massacre was one of the worst human rights violations in post-independent India. The West Bengal government forcibly evicted around 10,000 or more from the island of Sunderbans. Many were raped and murdered. Here are some horrifying accounts of the incidents.

item.title: New Book Aims to Decode the 'Magic Weight-Loss Pill'
item.description: "The Magic Weight-loss Pill", a self-help guide to weight loss and good health, is penned by renowned holistic lifestyle coach Luke Coutinho and popular Indian actor and yoga instructor Anushka Shetty.

item.title: Book Excerpt: 'But You Don't Look Like A Muslim' Urges You To See Beyond Religious Stereotypes
item.description: Jalil blends personal anecdotes beautifully to address larger and important questions about the perception of religious identities in pluralistic and culturally diverse societies of India.

item.title: Book Review: Zacharia's Flight of Fantasy in Search of Compassion
item.description: Paul Zacharia's "A Secret History of Compassion" valiantly drags the two disparate worlds of fiction and fact to a busy crossroads without traffic signals and then allows readers to revel in the sheer chaos that ensues.

item.title: New Book Dives Deep into the Love Life of Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb
item.description: Most hated Mughal emperor Aurangzeb had two Hindu wives, one of them wanted to perform ‘sati’ after his death!

item.title: World Book Day: 3 Books You Must Read This Election Season
item.description: This election season it's time to bury your nose in some of the best reads during the weekend.

item.title: Book Excerpt: Saba Naqvi's 'Politics of Jugaad' Explains Why Coalition Govt is a Good Option for India
item.description: In an age where they are also an outcome of very legitimate electoral processes, one can argue that coalitions can be fundamentally more just and representative than single-party regimes.

item.title: Book Excerpt: Martin Moore's 'Democracy Hacked' Explains Why Social Media is the New Political Battlefield
item.description: Narendra Modi used Twitter to bypass mainstream media and speak directly to the people, presenting himself as the voice of a silent majority.

item.title: 'I Just Try to Write Somebody’s Favourite Book': Markus Zusak, the Author of 'The Book Thief'
item.description: Markus Zusak, the wildly popular author of the young-adult novel, 'The Book Thief', doesn’t do anything by the book. He doesn’t believe that mystery is important to keep his readers engaged, nor does he follow the cardinal rule of creative writing -- show, not tell.

item.title: Book Excerpt: How the First Battle Over a Place of Worship Began in Ayodhya
item.description: Ayodhya: City of Faith, City of Discord is a comprehensive biography of the sleepy city of Ayodhya, which has been a place of reverence for many faiths for millennia, but has also been a place of violence, bloodshed and ill-will.

item.title: Book Excerpt: A Journalist Opens Up About Sexual Assault In His Autobiography 'Straight To Normal: My Life As A Gay Man'
item.description: 'Straight to Normal' is the autobiography of a gay man who had to battle bouts of confusion, vulnerability, fear, dejection and depression and also unlearn the normative definition of lust, love and everything in between, in order to thwart the desire to kill himself and find a reason to live.

item.title: ED Attaches Properties Worth Rs 147 Crore Belonging to Fugitive Businessman Nirav Modi
item.description: The attached movable and immovable properties of Nirav Modi are located in Mumbai and Surat in Gujarat, and have a market value of Rs 147,72,86,651.

item.title: Book Excerpt: Stressed About Your Board Exams? Here are Some Pro Tips to Follow
item.description: Here's an excerpt from How I Topped the Boards and You Can Too!, which urges you to fulfil all your Game of Thrones binge-watch cravings, and satiate your FOMO before you sit down to prepare for your boards.

item.title: Not Intolerance Anymore, It's Outright Dictatorship: Nayantara Sahgal
item.description: Nayantara Sahgal has said that the country is not facing intolerance anymore but is under outright dictatorship.

item.title: Arundhati Roy: Language Is My Friend, Fiction My First Love
item.description: Writer-activist Roy is the author of two fiction novels: The God of Small Things (1997) and The Ministry of Utmost Happiness (2017).

item.title: OPINION | How the ‘The Steel Frame’ of IAS Has Bent from British to Bharat
item.description: The Steel Frame: A History of the IAS by Deepak Gupta, is a rich magnum opus of the history of the civil services. Gupta, a retired IAS from 1974 batch, has given a comprehensive account of Indian civil services from the past, its present, and also the future of the IAS.

item.title: Love is Complicated. And Marriage is a Strange Beast: Book Review of Natasha Badhwar's 'Immortal for a Moment'
item.description: This moving collection of essays will essentially expand your heart if you let it. As Badhwar explains in the afterword, “Even if I cannot always articulate the motivation behind personal writing, I must not doubt its relevance.”

item.title: Meet the Woman Who Marched with a Naxal Platoon In the Tribal Belt of Central India
item.description: Alpa Shah talks about the book, Nightmarch, and her days in the Naxal heartland of Jharkhand to News18.com.

item.title: 20 Interesting Books From This Year That Deserve a Place in Your Bookshelf
item.description: If you haven't read them already, add them to your TBR list. Trust us, you won't be sorry.

item.title: Five Reads that will Help you Understand 'Brahminical Patriarchy' and What it Means
item.description: What exactly is 'Brahminical Patriarchy'? News18 lists some reads to help you understand it better.

item.title: Writer S Hussain Zaidi: I End up Withholding Much More Than Telling
item.description: S Hussain Zaidi is known for books like 'Mafia Queens of Mumbai', 'Black Friday', 'Headley and I' and 'My Name Is Abu Salem', some of which have got film adaptations.

item.title: Book Inspired by TV Show 'Crime Patrol' To be Launched on December 11
item.description: Westland Publishing will release 'Crime Patrol: The Most Thrilling Stories by Annup Sonii and Oswald Pereira', which has been endorsed by Bollywood actor Ajay Devgn.

item.title: It’s Time We Got Our Own Mythological Superhero: Vishwas Mudagal on His New Book The Last Avatar
item.description: In an exclusive chat, author Vishwas Mudagal talks about why Indians are reading mythological fiction more than ever, the legend of Kalki, his upcoming book and whether he is planning to write a self-help book anytime soon.

item.title: Margaret Atwood Pens Sequel Of The Handmaid's Tale Inspired By 'The World We Live In'
item.description: Atwood recently announced a sequel of the critically acclaimed book, which will be released 34 years after The Handmaid's Tale, on 10 September 2019, just in time for the 2020 US election.

item.title: Book Excerpt: Read How Mithali Raj Left Bharatanatyam For Cricket In 'Free Hit: The Story of Women's Cricket in India'
item.description: Zooming into the lives of women cricketers like Mithali Raj and Jhulan Goswami, author Suprita Das shows her readers what it takes for women to 'make it' in a sport like Cricket, which is almost a religion in India.

item.title: Bibliophiles! Here are the 4 Most Delightful Weekend Reads
item.description: Winters are here and so is the time to snuggle indoors with your book. Scroll down as we picked the best reads for your weekend.

item.title: Book Excerpt: In Her Memoir 'Becoming', Michelle Obama Recounts How She Found 'Ways To Adapt' In Marriage
item.description: Michelle Obama's memoir unfolds in her clear, witty and honest voice. She reconstructs her childhood days and youthful years in vivid details, filling the pages with deep reflective thoughts.

item.title: Former Kashmir Interlocutor Radha Kumar Talks About Challenges for Dineshwar Sharma in New Book
item.description: In the book, ‘Paradise at War: A Political History of Kashmir’, Kumar looks back at the days she spent in the valley trying to understand it at a very crucial time – when the Centre is dealing with one of the worst spells of violent unrests in the Valley.

item.title: Writing Process Messy, Full of Self Doubts: 'The Danish Girl' Writer David Ebershoff
item.description: David Ebershoff's debut novel "The Danish Girl" was adapted into an Academy Award-winning film of the same name in 2015, starring Eddie Redmayne.

item.title: Margaret Atwood Just Helped Out a Student With Her Homework Essay on 'The Handmaid's Tale'
item.description: The Man Booker Prize-winning Canadian author clarified why she used the theme of power in her 1985 distopian cult classic 'The Handmaid's Tale', which was published in 1985.

item.title: Vanara: 'Baahubali' Author Pens Downs New Book on Baali the Undefeated Hero of Ramayana

He said: “Partition of the country was demanded on the basis of enmity between Hindus and Muslims. So the actual partition would give this enmity a national and constitutional status and solution of the problem would become even more difficult.
